text: Robert P. Beattie (January 24, 1933 â€“ April 1, 2018) was an American skiing coach, skiing promoter and commentator for ABC Sports and ESPN. He was head coach of the U.S. Ski Team from 1961 to 1969. He co-founded the Alpine Skiing World Cup in 1966. His worked as a ABC included four Winter Olympic Games, from 1976 through 1988. Beattie died on April 1, 2018 in Fruita, Colorado from a long-illness at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Coaches Category:Sportspeople from New Hampshire Category:Sportspeople from Colorado Category:People from Manchester, New Hampshire
